page.title: 18Media in South Yorkshire
page.content: The best way of spreading{news}around the villages is by putting a poster in the village shops.There are also notice boards at the churches and one at school.Every month the parish newsletter is issued.All the{news about the parishes is in it.At school we used to run a newspaper called The Brodsworth Bugle.It contained{news about school and the village and had a puzzle page.All the articles were written by the children. Apart from the National Newspapers the villagers get The Yorkshire Post,The Doncaster Star and The Free Press.The Advertiser and Metro{News,}which is the local council paper,are free.The property guide is also free.The local{radio stations are{Radio}Sheffield,{Radio Hallam and Viking{Radio.}The channels we get on{television}are BBC1,BBC2, Yorkshire{Television}and channel 4.
